title: cryptogeniusdice
author: cryptogeniusdice
content: Need fair price or price at which i brought Bitcoin wrapped on fantom network.p2p onlyTelegram : skepticalman

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: cryptogeniusdice on December 04, 2023, 09:07:40 AMNeed fair price or price at which i brought Bitcoin wrapped on fantom network.p2p onlyTelegram : skepticalmanWould you mind sharing your fantom-wrapped Bitcoin address? The supply of Wrapped Bitcoin on the Fantom network is too limited. The current supply is 1000 BTC, and only one address holds 500 BTC. We have a list of the holder's addresses, and it's public. I would like to know which one is your address. I do not see any address that holds 64 Bitcoins. Please share your address unless you are just a scammer trying to scam forum members. Â  This is a bad try

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Hasn't even offered a payment method that is to be exchanged for the Fantom Wrapped bitcoin sale. Made the announcement on Bitcointalk but wants the deal to be done over telegram. This is rather unserious and fishy to me.Quote from: Learn Bitcoin on December 04, 2023, 09:22:34 AMWould you mind sharing your fantom-wrapped Bitcoin address? I will be damned if he does that.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on December 04, 2023, 09:56:06 PMHasn't even offered a payment method that is to be exchanged for the Fantom Wrapped bitcoin sale. Made the announcement on Bitcointalk but wants the deal to be done over telegram. This is rather unserious and fishy to me. This is typical of scammers. Since they do not have any chance of a real deal, they didn't even feel if someone wanted to exchange, what method they could offer? They didn't think it because they were not going to give the clients anything. Telegram is scammers paradise. I have seen this quote somewhere. They can delete the account, change the name, and handle it anytime they want, which is why they use telegram. Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on December 04, 2023, 09:56:06 PMQuote from: Learn Bitcoin on December 04, 2023, 09:22:34 AMWould you mind sharing your fantom-wrapped Bitcoin address? I will be damned if he does that.He won't be able to do that. There are no addresses that hold 64 Bitcoins. There are only 37 holders, and three of them hold 982 Bitcoin, which is 98.2% of the supply. The rest of the addresses hold less than 18 Bitcoins. So, how the hell can he have 64 Bitcoins? You can check the holder's addresses and the amount they hold; https://ftmscan.com/token/0x1e1fdb53451c5262a5ba449271789c7f551a9142#balances
